conclusion: Analyze the geometry of the semicircular glass brick and the angles involved.
The image shows a semicircular glass brick with a radius R. Light rays strike the base at an angle π - γ relative to the horizontal.
The critical angle γ is given, and it is specified that γ < π/2.
The angle of incidence π - γ is such that the light rays strike the base and then pass through the semicircular surface.
The tangent to the semicircular surface at the point of incidence makes an angle π - γ with the horizontal.
The tangent to the semicircular surface at the point of exit also makes an angle π - γ with the horizontal.
The angle between the tangent at the point of incidence and the tangent at the point of exit is 2γ.
The arc length corresponding to this angle is calculated using the formula for arc length: (θ/360) × 2πR.
Substituting θ = 2γ, the arc length is (2γ/360) × 2πR = (γ/90) × 2πR.
This arc length represents the width of the base through which light passes.
